climbs.name: Three Choss Blend for Your Pizza

content.description: Climb up the right side, using the arÃªte. Watch out for loose slabs, pebbles, and dirt.
content.protection: Trees at the top to set up TR anchor. Make sure you bring about 30 feet of anchor cord.
content.location: Find the two walls that meet in a 90 degree corner, with a rock pile at the bottom that makes them shorter than the other cliffs. This wall is one of the few ones with obvious holds.

content.description: Start on the small ledges on the left and climb up to the shelf. Move up and to the right of the plants. Use the sideways crimp and pocket to get up to the flake. Take a nice rest on the shelf. Finally, climb up to the big crack for the finish.
content.protection: Trees about 20 feet back from the cliff edge.
content.location: This wall juts out of the tallest section of cliffs. Look for the slightly overhanging slab visible from the parking lot; this wall protrudes out to the left.

pathTokens: e. Penobscot Bay to Schoodic Point

content.description: An old granite quarry. Granite from here was used in the Brooklyn Bridge. Most faces are sheer and smooth, but a very good climber could find holds. Plenty of opportunities for first ascents.There are lots of trees on top of the cliffs, but most are far back. Lots of trees have shallow roots, so check them for strength. There are no bolts. Make sure you have lots of accessory cord if you plan on setting toprope anchors.
